intro: Hartogia propinqua, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features small, white to pale yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of yellow tubular flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often growing in a basal rosette. Hartogia propinqua is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
